page.title: 17LOCAL HISTORY IN YATTON
page.content: There has been a settlement in or near Yatton since prehistoric times when men forfited Cadbury Hill.The remains of a large and well-appointed Roman villa were discoverd by the river one hundred years ago. The medieval linear village grew up along the ridge, surrounding the church and village green with its well. Next to the church can be seen the Old Rectory, a fine medieval house with decorated windows. Another interesting building is the 6OO year old dovecote at Ham Farm, North End. With the coming of the railway Yatton became increasingly important as the junction for Clevedon, and for Cheddar with its seasonal strawberry trade. It had its own cattle market which existed until a few years ago.
